title: 103_hr969
content: Appointments to military service academies by the Resident Representative to the United States for the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. The United States Military Academy appointment authority is amended to include one cadet from the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. Each nominee can now select a principal candidate and nine alternates for each vacancy. Domicile of cadets is also addressed in the amendment. The amendment specifies that candidates for admission must be domiciled in specific locations, including states, congressional districts, and certain territories. Conforming amendments are made to related sections. The United States Naval Academy appointment authority is also addressed. The appointment authority for the United States Naval Academy is amended to include a nominee from the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. Each person entitled to nominate a candidate can now nominate a principal candidate and nine alternates for each vacancy. Additionally, the domicile requirements for midshipmen are updated. The domicile requirements for candidates nominated for admission to the United States Naval Academy and the United States Air Force Academy have been updated to include specific locations such as states, congressional districts, and territories. Amendments have been made to sections 6954 and 6956 of the title to reflect these changes. Amendments have been made to section 9342 of title 10, United States Code, regarding the appointment authority for the United States Air Force Academy. One cadet from the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands can now be nominated by the Resident Representative in consultation with the Governor. Each person entitled to nominate a candidate can now nominate a principal candidate and nine alternates for each vacancy. Amendments to section 9342 of title 10, United States Code, now require cadets nominated for admission to be domiciled in specific locations. The effective date of these changes is specified. The effective date for the amendments to section 9342 of title 10, United States Code, regarding the nomination of candidates for military service academies is specified for classes entering after the enactment of this Act.
